channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

item.title: Report X-2023061728
item.description:
Report X-2023061728

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-27T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was damaged during delivery transit. When delivery truck returned, the package was located within the truck and placed into a Hazardous Materials bag to contain it. Once contained within the bag, the bag was moved to a transport cart for it be secured within the hazmat processing area for further examination and processing. Delivery truck was further looked over for any spillage within the truck, but none was found. DescribePack: Package failure was caused by an unsecure cap that caused the hazardous material bottle to leak/release into the shipping carton. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was secured once discovered within a Hazardous Materials bag and transported to the Hazmat processing area away from general personel.

item.title: Report I-2023060138
item.description:
Report I-2023060138

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: YRC GLOBAL
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading one drum was found punctured. The release was properly managed. The damaged drum was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023061610
item.description:
Report X-2023061610

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: DURHAM
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials tote and taken to the hazardous materials staging area away from personnel and other packages. DescribePack: Upon inspection it was noted that one of the plastic jugs of reagent alcohol was cracked at the bottom causing the contents to leak. There was no packaging in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was placed in a hazardous materials drum awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023061535
item.description:
Report X-2023061535

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at or around 1000 hours after dispatch. Package was taken to the QA cage for inspection, package appeared to be exposed to internal leakage. Package was placed inside of a plastic bin to contain leakage. DescribePack: One container inside the package appears to have spilled contents due to loose cap. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside of a plastic bin.
